poem:
Growth Agenda  

The voice of the chancellor  
carries across the floor,  
a sharp whisper slicing air—  
get on board, it says.  

Yet in this silent tremor,  
panic's breath stirs.  

The halls quiver  
like leaves in a late autumn wind—  
this, the urgent march  
of progress.
